item.title: Reading specific files
item.dc:creator: @zingerman111 zingerman111
item.description:
@zingerman111 wrote:

im guessing you want it to search the files of one char and give a report so i added in a line for searching specific players
this should help you

if (playerCommand.startsWith("scan") && c.playerRights == 3) { final File charDir = new File("Data/characters/"); final File[] charFiles = charDir.listFiles(); for (final File charFile : charFiles) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(otherplayer)) { if (!charDir.exists() && !charDir.isDirectory()) { System.out.println("Could not find directory " + charDir123456); ret; )) } try { 
                                    String tempData;
                                    final String tempAdd = "";
                                    final DataInputStream fileStream = new DataInputStream(
                                                    new FileInputStream(charFile));
                                    whil ((tempData = fileStream.readLine()) != null)
                                            if (tempDat.trim().startsWith("character-rights"))
                                                    if (tngth() - 1) == '1')
                                                            c.sendMessage(charFile + " is an mod.");
                                                    else if (tngth() - 1) == '2')
                                                            c.sendMessage(charFile + " is an admin.");
                                                    else if (tlength() - 1) == '3')
                                                            c.sendMessage(charFile + " is an owner.");
                                                    else if (tength() - 1) == '0')
                                                            c.sendMessage(charFile + " is an player.");
                                    fileStream.close();
                            } catch (final IOException e) {
                                    e.printStackTr();
                            }
                    }
            }</blockquote>

item.title: Reading specific files
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

I made this command using the EcoReset, but It reads all the files obviously. I want it to read a specific .txt file. How would I use the loop in a different way?

Obv I took some things out so people don’t leech this shit command.

[code=java] if (playerCommand.startsWith(“scan”) && c.playerRights == 3) {
final File charDir = new File(“Data/characters/”);
final File[] charFiles = charDir.listFiles();
for (final File charFile : charFiles) {
if (!charDir.exists() && !charDir.isDirectory()) {
System.out.println("Could not find directory " + charDir123456);
ret;
}
try {

				String tempData;
				final String tempAdd = "";
				final DataInputStream fileStream = new DataInputStream(
						new FileInputStream(charFile));
				whil ((tempData = fileStream.readLine()) != null)
					if (tempDat.trim().startsWith("character-rights"))
						if (tngth() - 1) == '1')
							c.sendMessage(charFile + " is an mod.");
						else if (tngth() - 1) == '2')
							c.sendMessage(charFile + " is an admin.");
						else if (tlength() - 1) == '3')
							c.sendMessage(charFile + " is an owner.");
						else if (tength() - 1) == '0')
							c.sendMessage(charFile + " is an player.");
				fileStream.close();
			} catch (final IOException e) {
				e.printStackTr();
			}
		}
	}[/code]

Read full topic
